heading: sgi 's first quarter free fall
subheading: silicon graphics takes a big first quarter hit, reporting an operating loss five times larger than analysts' expectations.
author: reuters
text: computer maker silicon graphics inc. wednesday reported a first quarter net operating loss of us$68 million or 37 cents per share, more than five times larger than the loss that most industry analysts had been expecting. the company blamed the short fall on a "temporary loss of momentum that has resulted from the recent management transition." in august, richard belluzzo abruptly resigned as chief executive officer and another company executive was named to succeed him.the 37 cent per share loss compares with a consensus analyst estimate for a loss of seven cents per share, according to first call, which tracks analyst forecasts. silicon graphics, which makes computers with advanced design features, said that after including restructuring charges it had a net loss of $213 million or $1.17 per share, compared with a loss of $44 million or 24 cents per share last year.revenues declined slightly to $425 million from $457 million.chief executive robert bishop said the company is "continuing to execute the turnaround plan announced in mid-august and has made solid progress in the past few months."in august, the company announced its second reorganization in 18 months, after an earlier restructuring was not as successful as hoped.
